intro: Aspidium connexum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf water fern, is a species of aquatic fern belonging to the family Dennstaedtiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped leaves that are typically less than 10 centimeters in length. The plant thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, such as ponds and marshes. Its rhizomes form dense underwater mats, contributing to water filtration and habitat creation for aquatic organisms. Aspidium connexum is often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere.
